description: 共同科英文（一）課程為一學年課程，每學期兩學分，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 增進學生英語溝通表達能力
透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**National Taiwan Normal University**

**109 Fall Semester (109 – 1)**

**English (I) syllabus**

Instructor: Long Hai Huynh (Harry) / 黃海龍

Email: longhhuynh@ntnu.edu.tw

Class time: 週一 Monday, 3 – 4 / 10:20am – 12:20pm, 公館 C006

*   **Course description**

This course aims to boost students’ English proficiency by strengthening their four English skills. In this course, there will be a wider variety of activities which engage students in contemporary topics with hands-on experience, sharpen their critical thinking, and enhance their communicative abilities. Students are expected to be more autonomous and active in their own learning.

*   **Course objectives:**

The course is designed to

1.  Develop students’ skills in English
2.  Enhance students’ knowledge of vocabulary and writing skills
3.  Build students’ confidence in writing in English
4.  Develop students’ teamwork and autonomy
5.  Broaden cultural and intercultural knowledge

*   **Textbook**

Daise, D., & Norloff, C. (2015). _Q: Skills for success – Reading and writing (Book 4)_. New York, NY: Cambridge University Press.

*   Grading policy and course requirements

1.  Grading policy

1.  Attendance and participation: 10%
2.  In-class and online quizzes: 20%
3.  Lexile test and self-study at lab: 10%
4.  Mid-term test: 30%
5.  Final test: 30%

1.  Course requirements 課程條件

*   _Attendance and participation (10%)_ _點名_

Class attendance is required and strictly checked. Students are expected to come to class every week, except for (a) hospitalized cases; or (b) emergencies; or (c) authorized absences. For these exceptions, evidence with the signature and stamp of the person in charge must be provided. For example, for hospitalized cases, a medical form that proves the student was hospitalized with the signature of the doctor and/or medical staff with his/her stamp must be submitted. Any absences apart from the exceptions mentioned above are counted, and each absence results in _1 point_ deducted in the attendance/participation score.

*   _In-class (offline) and online quizzes (20%)_ _在教室和上網小考_

Students are expected to take quizzes during class time or before a due date. Late submissions will result in 30% deduction in the score for quizzes. A submission which is received 2 days or later than due date or an absence on the day of the in-class quiz will be instantly marked zero. If there is an emergency happening on the due date, students should email the lecturer as soon as possible.

*   _Lexile test and self-study time at Pu 101 (10%) Lexile__考試和樸101__自學時間_

Students are required to take the Lexile test. This test will take place from Week 5 to Week 8.

Students can earn bonus for Lexile test by self-studying at Pu 101. Each study time, which lasts more than 30 minutes, will earn the student 1 point as a bonus for the Lexile score.

Conversion table for Lexile test

1200L level or above: 10 points

1100L: 9

1000L: 8

900L: 7

800L: 6

700L: 5

600L: 4

500L: 3

400L: 2

300L or below: 1 point

*   _Mid-term test (30%) and final test (30%)__期中考_ _和_ _期末考_

For the mid-term test, students will write sentences. These sentences will be marked based on 2 criteria: Vocabulary and Grammatical Structure.

For the final test, students will write one or two short paragraphs on a given topic. Their work will be marked based on the [IELTS Writing Task 2 band descriptors](https://www.ielts.org/-/media/pdfs/writing-band-descriptors-task-2.ashx?la=en), including 2 criteria: Task Response; Coherence & Cohesion.
